snippet: The African National Congress is deeply divided between those who want President Jacob Zuma elected for another term, and those seeking a fresh start.
abstract: African National Congress, gathering for conference to choose new leaders, is deeply divided between those who want Pres Jacob Zuma elected for another term, and those seeking fresh start; Zuma's deputy Kgalema Motlanthe is seeking to unseat Zuma as leader of party, which has been rocked by scandal and fierce public anger over deepening inequality, stark poverty and joblessness.
lead_paragraph: The African National Congress is deeply divided between those who want President Jacob Zuma elected for another term, and those seeking a fresh start.

headline.seo: Leadership Conference Highlights Deep A.N.C. Divisions in South Africa
headline.main: Leadership Meeting in South Africa Confronts Bitter Divisions in the A.N.C.
headline.print_headline: Leadership Meeting in South Africa Confronts Bitter Divisions in the A.N.C.
